text:
Polenka kissed her mother’s feet, weeping. Kolya and Lida stared, confused. They wore fancy dress, one in a turban, the other with an ostrich feather cap. Suddenly, they screamed.

Raskolnikov noticed the certificate of merit beside Katerina Ivanovna. 

Lebeziatnikov approached. 

“She is dead,” he said. 

Svidrigaïlov joined them. 

“Rodion Romanovitch, I need two words,” he said. 

Lebeziatnikov stepped back. 

“I’ll arrange the funeral,” Svidrigaïlov continued. “I have money. I’ll help the children.” 

Raskolnikov frowned. 

“What’s your motive?” he asked.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Polenka and the children react with horror to their mother's death, while Svidrigaïlov offers to arrange her funeral and support the orphans financially.
